senses.sense: used to show the length of time that something has been happening, from the time it began until the present
senses.dict_examp: I've lived in Cambridge for two years now.

senses.sense: used to say that something will happen very soon
senses.dict_examp: We're expecting our second child any day now.
senses.lear_examp: The evil creatures who were bound to come out of the dark would see Carla any minute now.

senses.sense: If something happens now and then, it happens sometimes but not very often.
senses.dict_examp: I love chocolate, but I only eat it now and then.
senses.lear_examp: If you really love to have a snack now and then, try to eat fruit and vegetables, instead of sweets.

senses.sense: sometimes, but not often
senses.dict_examp: We still get together for lunch every now and then.
senses.lear_examp: Each day choose 10 new words and learn them by heart. In a week you will have learned 70 new words, and in a year 3640, a lot of words. Please, do not forget to repeat them every now and then.

senses.sense: as a result of a new situation
senses.dict_examp: Now that I've got a car I can visit her more often.
senses.lear_examp: Now I am in England for further studies, I would be very grateful to you if you will give me the opportunity to join your club.

senses.sense: a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work
senses.dict_examp: Does Jake go to a nursery or a baby-sitter?
senses.lear_examp: I enjoy working with children because I was working  in a nursery.

senses.sense: the food that you eat and the way that it affects your health
senses.dict_examp: Good nutrition is essential for growing children.
senses.lear_examp: So, good exercise combined with the right nutrition (low fat, vegetables etc.) will alter our lives and help us feel and appear more relaxed.

senses.sense: the eleventh month of the year, after October and before December
senses.dict_examp: 5(th) of November/November 5(th)
senses.lear_examp: I have an exam on 22nd of November 2006.

senses.sense: someone whose job is to care for sick and injured people
senses.dict_examp: He worked as a nurse in a psychiatric hospital.
senses.lear_examp: I want to be a nurse.

senses.sense: to care for a person or animal that is ill
senses.dict_examp: We nursed the injured sparrow back to health.
senses.lear_examp: Second, there are more and more old people who need to be looked after or nursed.

senses.sense: a person who writes novels
senses.dict_examp: His father was a novelist.
senses.lear_examp: My teacher has told me that you are a British novelist who writes crime stories, and you have come to live in our area.

senses.sense: easy to see or be aware of
senses.dict_examp: There was a noticeable difference in his behavior after the injury.
senses.lear_examp: What was noticeable all over Warsaw were the overfilled garbage cans and litter in the streets that nobody cleaned up.

senses.sense: a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance or quality
senses.dict_examp: 'Doctor', 'tree', 'party', 'coal' and 'beauty' are all nouns.

senses.sense: famous for something bad
senses.dict_examp: a notorious criminal
senses.lear_examp: Apart from this, Bristol is notorious for its poor social policy for the people who are on the poverty line.

senses.sense: a book that tells a story about imaginary people and events
senses.dict_examp: historical/romantic novels
senses.lear_examp: Yesterday I was sat on the bench under a tree in that wonderful garden and I was reading an interesting novel by Jane Austen, when a charming young boy came near to me.

senses.sense: at the present time, especially when compared to the past
senses.dict_examp: Everything seems more expensive nowadays.
senses.lear_examp: Well, nowadays I hardly ever watch television, as time is something that I really don't have enough of.
